#Simulating data
```{r numpy}
import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Set up seed
np.random.seed(111)

# True parameter values
beta = [0,5]

# Size of dataset
n = 1000

# simulate X
X = np.random.randn(n)
# Simulate outcome variable
Y = beta[0] + beta[1]*X + np.random.randn(n)

plt.figure(figsize=(4,4))
plt.plot(X,Y)
plt.savefig("testing.png")

print("first 10 obs of Y")
print(Y[1:10])
print("first 10 obs of X")
print(X[1:10])

```

```{r pymc}
import numpy as np
from pymc3 import Model, Normal, HalfNormal, find_MAP, NUTS, sample, Slice, traceplot, summary
from scipy import optimize


# Set up seed
np.random.seed(111)

# True parameter values
alpha = 1
beta = 10

# Size of dataset
n = 1000

# simulate X
X = np.random.randn(n)
# Simulate outcome variable
Y = alpha + beta*X + np.random.randn(n)

basic_model = Model()

with basic_model:
    # Priors for unknown model parameters
    alpha = Normal('alpha', mu=0, sd=10)
    beta = Normal('beta', mu=0, sd=10)
    sigma = HalfNormal('sigma', sd=1)

    # Expected value of outcome
    mu = alpha + beta*X 

    # Likelihood (sampling distribution) of observations
    Y_obs = Normal('Y_obs', mu=mu, sd=sigma, observed=Y)

map_estimate = find_MAP(model=basic_model)
print(map_estimate)


with basic_model:

    # obtain starting values via MAP
    start = find_MAP(fmin=optimize.fmin_powell)

#     # instantiate sampler
#     step = Slice(vars=[sigma]) 

    # draw 1000 posterior samples
    trace = sample(1000, start=start) 
    
summary(trace)

```
